content: in next st 2 single_crochet 2sc in next st 5 single_crochet 2sc in next st single_crochet 22 sts rounds 10 & 11 single_crochet in each st around 22 sts round 12 single_crochet 2sc in next st 7 single_crochet 2sc in next st 2 single_crochet 2sc in next st 7 single_crochet 2sc in each of next 2 sts 27 sts- head complete round 13 pattern set-up round *single_crochet into back loop only of next st single_crochet repeat from * to one st before marker single_crochet in back loop only 27 sts round 14 *half_double_crochet into front loop left exposed of next st of previous round single_crochet into back loop only of following st on your current round repeat from * to one st before marker half_double_crochet into front loop of next st of previous round 27 sts round 15 *single_crochet into back loop only of next st half_double_crochet into front loop left exposed of next st of previous round repeat from * to one st before marker single_crochet into back loop only 27 sts rounds 16-33 repeat rounds 14 & 15 nine more times 27 sts *snap in or sew on eyes at this point they are harder to place when the body starts narrowing also add stuffing to the nose and head area while you can push it in with your fingers round 34 single_crochet decrease 7 single_crochet decrease 2 single_crochet decrease 7 single_crochet decrease decrease 22 sts rounds 35 & 36 single_crochet in each st around 22 sts round 37 single_crochet decrease 5 single_crochet decrease 2 single_crochet decrease 5 single_crochet decrease single_crochet 18 sts rounds 38 & 39 single_crochet in each st around 18 sts * add a little more stuffing to the body round 40 single_crochet decrease 3 single_crochet decrease 2 single_crochet decrease 3 single_crochet decrease single_crochet 14 sts rounds 41 & 42 single_crochet in each st around 14 sts round 43 single_crochet decrease single_crochet decrease 2 single_crochet decrease single_crochet decrease single_crochet 10 sts rounds 44 & 45 single_crochet in each st around 10 sts *finish filling your salmon with stuffing make sure to pack in tightly because it can compress over time a knitting needle or crochet hook can be helpful for pushing the stuffing into all areas *squeeze the body stitches together flat to make two row of 5 sts facing each other and single_crochet the two row together 5 single_crochet the tail section will be worked flat tail row 1 chain 1 single_crochet in each st to end of row chain 1 turn 5 single_crochet tail row 2 2 single_crochet in first st 3 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in last st chain 1 turn 7 single_crochet tail row 3 single_crochet in each st to end of row chain 1 turn 7 single_crochet tail row 4 2 single_crochet in first st 5 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in last st chain 1 turn 9 single_crochet tail row 5 single_crochet in each st to end of row chain 1 turn 9 single_crochet tail row 6 2 single_crochet in first st
